revised_title: Scent Organs and Courtship Behavior in Male Euploea core asela Butterflies
tldr: The author examines the scent organs in male Euploea core asela butterflies and their role in attracting females during courtship flights. The scent organs, or scent-brushes, are used to produce and disperse scents that attract females from a distance. The author also discusses the structure and function of these scent organs, as well as their relationship to the wing-glands in male butterflies.
